test-case.name: base-uri-001
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative) where $relative is an absolute URI. The result is $relative unchanged. $relative value is a literal string, node, variable and subsequence.

test-case.name: base-uri-002
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative) where $relative is an absolute URI. The result is $relative unchanged. $relative value is a literal string, node, variable and subsequence.

test-case.name: base-uri-003
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative) where $relative is an empty string.

test-case.name: base-uri-004
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative) where $relative is the empty sequence.

test-case.name: base-uri-005
test-case.description: Testcase to verify that the result from fn:resolve-uri($relative) is of type xs:anyURI.

test-case.name: base-uri-006
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative) where $relative is a relative URI. Different argument syntax constructs are tested.

test-case.name: base-uri-007
test-case.description: Testcase to verify that the result from fn:resolve-uri($relative, $base) is of type xs:anyURI.

test-case.name: base-uri-008
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:static-base-uri to verify the result is of type xs:anyURI.

test-case.name: base-uri-009
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:static-base-uri to return the base-uri property defined on the xsl:stylesheet element.

test-case.name: base-uri-010
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:static-base-uri to return the base-uri property which has been overriden several times by descendant elements.

test-case.name: base-uri-011
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:base-uri to verify the result is of type xs:anyURI.

test-case.name: base-uri-012
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:base-uri($arg) where $arg is the empty sequence. The empty sequence is returned.

test-case.name: base-uri-013
test-case.description: Test with fn:base-uri($arg) on a temporary tree that consists entirely of locally constructed elements and attributes.

test-case.name: base-uri-014
test-case.description: Test with base-uri() on LRE and elements created with xsl:element. Stylesheet and each element has different xml:base explicitly set.

test-case.name: base-uri-015
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:base-uri($arg) where $arg is an attribute, text or comment node created from scratch and with no parents.

test-case.name: base-uri-016
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:base-uri of a variable. Relative URI is set in @xml:base on the variable instruction.

test-case.name: base-uri-017
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative, $base) where $relative is an absolute URI. The result is $relative unchanged. $relative and $base values are a literal strings, nodes, variables and subsequences.

test-case.name: base-uri-018
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative, $base) where $relative is a relative URI. $relative is resolved agains $base. $relative and $base values are a literal strings, nodes, variables and subsequences.

test-case.name: base-uri-019
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative) where $relative is an empty string. Value of $base is returned.

test-case.name: base-uri-020
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:resolve-uri($relative) where $relative is the empty sequence. Empty sequence is returned no mather what the value of $base is.

test-case.name: base-uri-021
test-case.description: Testcase to verify that base-uri() and base-uri(.) return the same result.

test-case.name: base-uri-022
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:base-uri($arg) to verify the result if of type xs:anyURI. Includes test with document node

test-case.name: base-uri-023
test-case.description: Testcase with fn:base-uri($arg) on six kinds of nodes: processing-instruction, comment node, element node, text node, attribute node, namespace node. Base-uri property is declared on nodes themselves or on their ancestors.

test-case.name: base-uri-024
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied single element node (no parents).

test-case.name: base-uri-025
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created element.

test-case.name: base-uri-026
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node (no parents).

test-case.name: base-uri-027
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created element.

test-case.name: base-uri-028
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created element that has an xml:base attribute. The copied node's parent in the input file has xml:base set.

test-case.name: base-uri-029
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created document node with no xml:base attribute.

test-case.name: base-uri-030
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created document node (containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute).

test-case.name: base-uri-031
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created document node with no xml:base attribute.

test-case.name: base-uri-032
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created element with @xml:base and the copied node had an @xml:base=absolute-URI in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-033
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created document node, containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute, and the copied element had an @xml:base=absolute-URI in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-034
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created element with @xml:base and the copied node had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the sources file.

test-case.name: base-uri-035
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created document node, containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute, and the copied element had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-036
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created element with @xml:base and the copied node's parent had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-037
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created element with @xml:base and the copied node's parent had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-038
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created document node, containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute, and the copied node's parent had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-039
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created document node, containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute, and the copied node's parent had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-040
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) and two nested xsl:copy instructions. Base-uri of second copied node is the base-uri of its parent -the first copied node.

test-case.name: base-uri-041
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created element that has an xml:base attribute.The copied node's parent in the input file has xml:base set.

test-case.name: base-uri-042
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created document node (containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute).

test-case.name: base-uri-043
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node which has an @xml:base=absolute-URI in the source file. The copy of the element node has no parent.

test-case.name: base-uri-044
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a copied element node attached as a child to a newly created element with @xml:base and the copied node had an @xml:base=absolute-URI in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-045
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created document node, containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute, and the copied element had an @xml:base=absolute-URI in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-046
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node which has an @xml:base=relative-URI in the source file. The copy of the element node has no parent.

test-case.name: base-uri-047
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created element with @xml:base and the copied node had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-048
test-case.description: Test with base-uri($arg) where $arg is a deep copy of an element node attached as a child to a newly created document node, containing variable has an explicit xml:base attribute, and the copied element had an xml:base=relative-URI attribute in the source file.

test-case.name: base-uri-049
test-case.description: Test static-base-uri() in different parts of the stylesheet where the base URI varies.

test-case.name: base-uri-050
test-case.description: Test effect of implicit static-base-uri() in different parts of the stylesheet where the base URI varies.
